lead_paragraph: ROSENTHAL--J. Robert MD, on January 14, 2016. Born and raised in Brooklyn, graduate of Chicago Medical School, Class of '57. After completing his residency at The New York Eye and Ear Infirmary, he went into practice with his father, the late Benjamin C. and his brothers, the late Morton and Gerald. In his later years he served as Chief Medical Officer at The New York Eye and Ear Infirmary. He also served for 20 years on the Great Neck School Board. Survived by his wife Gladys (nee Stern), children Jill, Peter and Daniel, grandchildren Charlie, Emily, Isaac, Elijah, Harry and Sam, and uncle to Jeanne, Karen, Benjamin, Lisa, Laura R., Laura O. and the late Shari. Memorial service Sunday, January 17th, 2pm at "The Riverside," 76 St. and Amsterdam Ave. Donations in his memory to Doctors without Borders would be appreciated. 1

headline.main: Paid Notice: Memorials  ROSENTHAL, J. ROBERT MD, ON JANUARY 14, 2016. BORN AND RAISED IN BROOKLYN, GRADUATE OF CHICAGO MEDICAL SCHOOL, CLASS OF '57. IN HIS LATER YEARS HE SERVED AS CHIEF MEDICAL OFFICER AT THE NEW YORK EYE AND EAR INFIRMARY. HE ALSO SERVED FOR 20 YEARS ON THE GREAT NECK SCHOOL BOARD. SURVIVED BY HIS WIFE GLADYS (NEE STERN), CHILDREN JILL, PETER AND DANIEL, GRANDCHILDREN CHARLIE, EMILY, ISAAC, ELIJAH, HARRY AND SAM, AND UNCLE TO JEANNE, KAREN, BENJAMIN, LISA, LAURA R., LAURA O. AND THE LATE SHARI. MEMORIAL SERVICE SUNDAY, JANUARY 17TH, 2PM AT "THE RIVERSIDE," 76 ST. AND AMSTERDAM AVE. DONATIONS IN HIS MEMORY TO DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS WOULD BE APPRECIATED. 1
